question.text:
Correlate the hormone levels with its levels for given below days?


(i) 1-5 days
(ii) 12-14 days
(iii) 25-28 days (if the ovum is not fertilised).

options.text:
(i) LH decreases and FSH increases.
(ii) LH increases and FSH decreases.
(iii) LH level maintained and FSH level increases.

(i) LH increases and FSH decreases.
(ii) LH decreases and FSH increases.
(iii) LH level increases and FSH level maintained.

(i) LH increases and FSH decreases.
(ii) LH peaks and FSH peaks.
(iii) LH level decreases and FSH level maintained.

(i) LH peaks and FSH peaks.
(ii) LH increases and FSH decreases.
(iii) LH level decreases and FSH level maintained.

solution.text:
(i) LH increases and FSH decreases to ensure the maturity of the graffian follicle. This time, the menstrual flow occurs.
(ii) LH peaks and FSH peaks and attain the highest level. Rapid secretion of LH leads to its maximum level during the mid-cycle called LH surge. This induces rupture of Graffian follicle and thereby the release of an ovum (ovulation)
(iii) LH level decreases and FSH level maintained for the initiation of a new cycle.
